question: Besides the treasury accounts, accounts of Public Works and Forest transactions, accounts are received from certain other departmental officers for the departmental commercial undertakings, functioning under them and from Pay and Accounts Offices of State Governments functioning at their State Capitals.
the concerned Departmental Officers Pay and Accounts Officers are placed in funds with the bank directly by the Government through the AG or otherwise
These officers render monthly compiled accounts (along with or without the vouchers schedules as may be decided in each individual case), and a list shewing the particulars of cheques drawn by them.
These compiled accounts of departmental officers and of the PAOs are to be dealt with in the same manner as treasury accounts, Classified and consolidated abstracts should be prepared
The expenditure shown in these compiled accounts of departmental officers are to be brought to account under the relevant major minor sub-head of account, affording
Suitable sub-heads should be opened for each specified department or scheme
The paid cheques received from the bank by the treasury/PAO will be forwarded to the AG along with the daily scrolls

The Cr and Dr under the head 8670 will be linked in the AG's Office and final adjustment and outstanding under the this head pertaining to departmental officers is ensured through a suitable broadsheet
